data.title: Arrays Manipulation
data.description: Arrays are structures that let you store multiple values in a single variable. JavaScript offers several methods for working with arrays:

items.description: Adds elements to the end of an array.
Removes the last element from an array.
Removes the first element from an array.
Adds elements to the beginning of an array.

manipulation.title: Iter Over Arrays
manipulation.description: Executes a function for each array element.

manipulation.title: Transform Arrays
manipulation.description: Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the array.

manipulation.title: Search in Arrays
manipulation.description: Search for elements in an array that meet a condition.

manipulation.title: Sort Arrays
manipulation.description: Sorts the elements of an array in place and returns the array.

data.conclusion: This overview should help you understand the basics of string and array manipulation in JavaScript, enhancing your ability to handle data and improve the interactivity of your web applications.
